children.subject: what... I'm not declared (first-year), and I got enrolled into 170.

https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy

the enrollment policies say that undeclared students won't be able to enroll into cs upper divisions until the adjustment period, so idk, maybe you are a special case or sth
^pretty much, I have no clue how I got in. I'll just count my blessings
Have you been enrolled in 170? If you have that means enrollment recognizes you as declared.

history.content:
Hi there, 


This is a unique situation. One cannot be declared in an L&S Major unless their record shows they're in the L&S college. It looks like your change of college has not been fully processed yet. I would suggest emailing the Adviser who approved your request (Alicia Mandac) and asklns@berkeley.edu. 

I would also open a ticket with Cal Student Central. I think it's best to approach this from all angles. http://studentcentral.berkeley.edu/

Please ensure you've reviewed @2571 regarding conflict issues. Maybe @Michael-David Sasson  can offer some additional advise

Hi there,

I would also open a ticket with Cal Student Central. I think it's best to approach this from all angles. http://studentcentral.berkeley.edu/

Please ensure you've

I switched from CoC to L&S 3 months ago, got email confirmation for said switch, and recently got the email saying I'm declared. However, CalCentral hasn't updated my major (it still says Chemical Engineering) and I'm worried this will affect my enrollment.

So I messed up pretty bad when signing up for CS188 and I put myself on the waitlist for a section that conflicts with CS170 lecture. I didn't notice this time conflict until really recently, so I don't know if I can still submit the forms to override the conflict. I have a really good position in the waitlist for this section, and I definitely could get in if it weren't for the conflict. 

There are other open sections for CS188 that don't conflict with my schedule but they all have really long waitlists and I'm worried that if I switch (since CalCentral says I'm Chemical Engineering) I'll lose my current waitlist position and get placed on the longer waitlist for another section. This wouldn't be a problem if I knew the system considered me a Computer Science major, but I'm not sure if it does or not.

Any advice as to what I should do? It's the weekend so there's nobody I can contact, and by Monday it'll be adjustment period and all chance I had of getting into the class will be gone.
history.subject: Got the email saying I'm declared, but CalCentral didn't update my major

history.content:
I switched from CoC to L&S 3 months ago, got email confirmation for said switch, and recently got the email saying I'm declared. However, CalCentral hasn't updated my major (it still says Chemical Engineering) and I'm worried this will affect my enrollment.

So I messed up pretty bad when signing up for CS188 and I put myself on the waitlist for a section that conflicts with CS170 lecture. I didn't notice this time conflict until really recently, so I don't know if I can still submit the forms to override the conflict. I have a really good position in the waitlist for this section, and I definitely could get in if it weren't for the conflict. 

There are other open sections for CS188 that don't conflict with my schedule but they all have really long waitlists and I'm worried that if I switch (since CalCentral says I'm Chemical Engineering) I'll lose my current waitlist position and get placed on the longer waitlist for another section. This wouldn't be a problem if I knew the system considered me a Computer Science major, but I'm not sure if it does or not.
